intro: Wahlenbergia perennis, commonly known as the everlasting daisy, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, daisy-like flowers that range in color from white to purple. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy soils and salty air. Its flowers are long-lasting, which contributes to its common name. Wahlenbergia perennis is often cultivated for ornamental purposes due to its attractive appearance and hardy nature.
